DataElement.preferredName: Non Cancer Tissue Normal Control Slide Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric and alphabetic characters used as identification for a non-cancer control slide.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non Cancer Tissue Normal Control Slide
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI)_The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another._A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created and released for TCGA per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 5/29/12

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive and coordinated effort to accelerate understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of genome analysis technologies, including large-scale genome sequencing. This project is a joint effort of the National Cancer Institute and the National Human Genome Research Institute. (http://cancergenome.nih.gov/abouttcga)_One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
